quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Record and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, buckethead, aguileras. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: When did Zakk Wylde form Black Label Society?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1998

questions.question: Who won the 1998 Grammy Award for Record of the Year?

options.text: Sunny Came Home by Shawn Colvin
I Believe I Can Fly by R. Kelly
Everyday Is a Winding Road by Sheryl Crow

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sunny Came Home by Shawn Colvin

questions.question: Metallica and Megadeth are the only bands that Dave Mustaine has been in or formed.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This song was the winner of the 1997 Grammy Award for Record of the Year.

options.text: Because You Loved Me by Celine Dion
Change the World by Eric Clapton
Give Me One Reason by Tracy Chapman

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Change the World by Eric Clapton

questions.question: What album did vocalist Phillip Anselmo first record with Pantera?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Power Metal

questions.question: What is the real name of Buckethead, the musician who used to wear a KFC bucket on his head, when performing in his theatrical persona?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brian Carroll

questions.question: Dragons Kiss is the first solo album by this speedy guitarist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marty Friedman

questions.question: What song won the Grammy Award for Record of the Year in 1999?

options.text: Youre Still the One by Shania Twain
My Heart Will Go On by Celine Dion
The Boy Is Mine by Brandy  Monica

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My Heart Will Go On by Celine Dion

questions.question: Finish the lyrics from Beyonces song Listen: The time has come for...

options.text: ... for me to stand up for love.
... for my dreams to be heard.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ... for my dreams to be heard.

questions.question: Who played guitar for Halford before joining Damageplan, as their vocalist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pat Lachman

questions.question: Kerry King tried out for Metallica when Dave Mustaine was fired from the group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Christina Aguileras Fighter goes like this: After all of the stealing and cheating you probably think that...

options.text: ... Ill just break down and cry.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ... I hold resentment for you.

questions.question: What guitarist is a founding member of heavy metal bands Pantera and Damageplan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dimebag Darrell

questions.question: Is it true that Angus Young, lead guitarist and co-founder of AC/DC, was born in Australia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: What artist won the 1996 Grammy Award for Record of the Year?

options.text: Mariah Carey and  Boyz II Men for One Sweet Day
Seal for Kiss from a Rose
Joan Osborne for One of Us

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seal for Kiss from a Rose

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Lyrics
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, rest, line. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What song received the Academy Award for Best Original Song for 1975?

Theme from Mahogany (Do You Know Where Youre Going To)
Richards Window from The Other Side of the Mountain

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Im Easy from Nashville

questions.question: Finish this line from N Syncs Gone: Now that we are apart...

options.text: ... did you find another loving heart?
... Im afraid of a new start.
... every second seems like an eternity.
... am I still in your heart?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ... am I still in your heart?

options.text: Evergreen (Love Theme from A Star Is Born)

questions.question: The Academy Award for Best Original Song for 1974 was given to this song.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: We May Never Love Like This Again from The Towering Inferno

questions.question: Finish the lyrics of Whitney Houstons song Heartbreak Hotel: I thought that u were someone who would do me right until you...

options.text: ... fooled around with her and that just broke my heart.
... stole my car and sold it to some other guy.
... ran away but baby you just wont go far.
... played with my emotions and you made me cry.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ... played with my emotions and you made me cry.

questions.question: Name the winner of the Academy Award for Best Original Song for 1971.

options.text: Life Is What You Make It from Kotch
Bless the Beasts and Children from Bless the Beasts and Children
The Age of Not Believing from Bedknobs and Broomsticks

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Theme from Shaft

questions.question: What comes after these lines from Marc Anthony and Tina Arenas song I Want To Spend My Lifetime Loving You: Save the night, save the day, save the love, come what may...

options.text: ... Even if we are not here to stay.
... Love will always find a way.
... Love is worth everything we pay.
... Heaven knows what can happen in a day.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ... Love is worth everything we pay.

questions.question: What song won the Academy Award for Best Original Song for 1977?

options.text: Candle on the Water from Petes Dragon
Nobody Does It Better from The Spy Who Loved Me
You Light Up My Life from You Light Up My Life
Someones Waiting for You from The Rescuers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: You Light Up My Life from You Light Up My Life

options.text: The Morning After from The Poseidon Adventure
Marmalade, Molasses  Honey from The Life and Times of Judge Roy Bean
Come Follow, Follow Me from The Little Ark

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Morning After from The Poseidon Adventure

questions.question: Complete this line from Mariah Careys Butterfly: I have learned that beauty...

options.text: ... has to flourish in the light.
... has to spread its wings and fly.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ... has to flourish in the light.

questions.question: Finish the lyrics of Mary J. Bliges song No More Drama: It feels so good when you...

options.text: ... get rid of everything that breaks your heart.
... listen to the words I say.
... let go of all the drama in your life.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ... let go of all the drama in your life.

questions.question: Finish these lyrics from Toni Braxtons love ballad Un-Break My Heart: Dont leave me here with these tears...

options.text: ... Come and kiss this pain away.
... Cuz my heart it breaking down.
... Take my hand and save the day.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ... Come and kiss this pain away.

questions.question: This song was honored with the Academy Award for Best Original Song at the 46th ceremony in 1974.

options.text: Live And Let Die from Live And Let Die
The Way We Were from The Way We Were
Nice to Be Around from Cinderella Liberty

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Way We Were from The Way We Were

questions.question: Finish the lyrics of Michael Jacksons You Are Not Alone: Everyday I sit and ask myself ...

options.text: ... why did you have to go away.
... when am I gonna be OK.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ... how did love slip away.

questions.question: Whats the rest of this verse from Madonnas song Frozen: Youre frozen when...

options.text: ... you dont life for the moment.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ... your hearts not open.

The band claim there were no particular groups that inspired them.

questions.question: In the movie Babe, Farmer Hoggett sings a song to Babe, the pig. What piece by composer Camille Saint-Saens does this melody come from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Symphony no. 3

questions.question: What church mode does the second movement of Brahms Symphony no. 4, Andante moderato, begin in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phrygian

questions.question: Which piece begins with a 15-note monophonic phrase followed by chords played by the woodwinds?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lizst, Les Preludes

questions.question: The Rite of Spring by Igor Stravinski is an atonal piece.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which piece by Johannes Brahms could be called a Chaconne?

options.text: Symphony no. 4, Allegro energico e passionato

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Symphony no. 4, Allegro energico e passionato

questions.question: Which of these nominees won the Academy Award for Best Original Song for 1979?

options.text: It Goes Like It Goes from Norma Rae
Ill Never Say Goodbye from The Promise
Through the Eyes of Love from Ice Castles
The Rainbow Connection from The Muppet Movie

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It Goes Like It Goes from Norma Rae

questions.question: What church mode is the main theme of the television show The Simpsons mostly written in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lydian

questions.question: A section of what scale, played by the low strings, does Hector Berliozs Symphonie Fantastique, 5th movement begin with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Octatonic

questions.question: Billy Talent is the name of which of the following?

options.text: A band consisting of Ben Kowalewicz, Ian DSa, Jon Gallant and Aaron Solowoniuk
A band consisting of Jon Gallant,  Ian DSa and Andrew Costello
A duo consisting of Billy Allen and Mark Talent

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A band consisting of Ben Kowalewicz, Ian DSa, Jon Gallant and Aaron Solowoniuk

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Donkey and Quote
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, nativity. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Name the winner of the Academy Award for Best Original Song for 1999.

options.text: Youll Be in My Heart from Tarzan
Music of My Heart from Music of the Heart
Blame Canada from South Park: Bigger, Longer  Uncut

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Youll Be in My Heart from Tarzan

questions.question: “That which is called firmness in a king is called obstinacy in a donkey” is a quote by an American author and educator.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Erskine

questions.question: Which statesman uttered these words: “Thus, by every device from the stick to the carrot, the emaciated Austrian donkey is made to pull the Nazi barrow up an ever-steepening hill”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winston Churchill

questions.question: What song was honored with the Academy Award for Best Original Song at the 69th ceremony in 1997?

options.text: You Must Love Me from Evita
Because You Loved Me from Up Close  Personal
I Finally Found Someone from The Mirror Has Two Faces

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: You Must Love Me from Evita

questions.question: This Welsh-born English poet said: If a donkey bray at you, dont bray at him”.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Herbert

questions.question: “I do believe the Democratic party has moved far to the right. I do believe that the party has a bunch of elephants running around in donkey clothes.” is a quote by this outstanding American reverend.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al Sharpton

questions.question: “I lived in the US for donkeys years so it has been a journey back in time for me. If you have had personal experience of something, it is always more authentic.” is a quote by this Australian author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colleen McCullough

questions.question: “Do you think yourself wise? Then theres a donkey inside your waistcoat” is a quote from one of the British preacher/theologians of the 19th century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles H. Spurgeon

My Heart Will Go On from Titanic

questions.question: “In school nativity plays I was always the bloody little donkey, I was never Mary.” says this singer-songwriter who is also famous as a member of an all female group. Who is she?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Geri Halliwell

options.text: Thatll Do from Babe: Pig in the City

A Soft Place To Fall from The Horse Whisperer
I Dont Want to Miss a Thing from Armageddon

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: When You Believe from The Prince of Egypt

questions.question: There is no glory in outstripping donkeys” was a statement by this Greek Emperor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marcus Aurelius

questions.question: Which modern day comedian annoyed his wife with this saying: “I kept giving her donkey ears.”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chevy Chase

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Slow

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Couple and History
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, nickname, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The beautiful Egyptian queen was chief wife of an Egyptian Pharaoh in 14th century BC. The couple remained in history as great reformers due to the profound religious changes they made - they introduced the monotheistic worship of the sun disk.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amenhotep IV and Nefertiti

questions.question: Being romantic poets, these two had a really romantic relationship. They knew how to do it, including all the elements a romantic story needs: secret courtship, love poems and everything necessary for their love to thrive.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert and Elizabeth Browning

questions.question: “Let him not recite the Veda on horseback, nor on a tree, nor on an elephant, nor in a boat ,or ship , nor on a donkey, nor on camel, nor standing on barren ground, nor riding in a carriage.” was spoken by one of the 11 gurus of India. Which one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guru Nanak

questions.question: She was a successful Hollywood actress and he was the president of the USA.  They never managed to be together legally, but their relationship was a public secret.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marilyn Monroe and John Kennedy

questions.question: Jerry West
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mr. Clutch

questions.question: “Yeah, blindfolds, just like pin the tail on us. Were the donkey.” is a quote from an American lead vocalist and musician of a heavy metal band. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vince Neil

questions.question: The most famous gangster couple in history, her last name was Parker and he was the anti-authoritarian criminal Barrow.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bonnie and Clyde

questions.question: He was a famous French conqueror,  but this wasnt enough for her to accept the marriage proposal immediately. She hesitated at first, but finally agreed.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Napoleon and Josephine

questions.question: In 1898, three years after their marriage,  this scientific couple  discovered polonium and radium. Thus,  they won the Physics Nobel Prize in 1903 for discovering radioactivity.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marie and Pierre Curie

questions.question: When the ruler of the Mughal Empire married his favorite wife, they were still teenagers. She gave birth to 14 children. After her death  in 1629, the grieving emperor created one of worlds most beautiful edifices - Taj Mahal, paying tribute to his beloved wife.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shah Jahan and Mumtaz Mahal

questions.question: On April 9, 2005 their marriage ended years of speculation on a relationship which has spanned the decades since they first met in 1970.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles and Camilla

questions.question: Red Grange
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Galloping Ghost

questions.question: Philosophy brought together this ancient Greek couple.  The wife had a courtesan salon which was frequented by many of the philosophers we now know, but only one of them got to really know her. Noted for her great intellectual power, she gave him inspiration for his work in rhetorics.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aspasia and Pericles

questions.question: After the death of her lover, Cleopatra found true love.  Though Egypt and Rome did not get along,  these two people married in 36 B.C, planning to conquer Rome.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antony and Cleopatra

questions.question: Babe Ruths nickname
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sultan of Swat
